title: Rates of Change - sum of two functions

content.question: ​The function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> has a negative average rate of change on every interval of <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> in the interval <math alttext="0 less or equal than x less or equal than 10"><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>10</mn></math>. The function <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> has a negative average rate of change on every interval of <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> in the interval <math alttext="0 less or equal than x less than 5"><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>5</mn></math>, and a positive average rate of change on every interval of <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> in the interval <math alttext="5 less than x less or equal than 10"><mn>5</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>10</mn></math>. Which of the following statements must be true about the function <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math>, defined by <math alttext="h open parentheses x close parentheses equals f open parentheses x close parentheses plus g open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>+</mo><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math>, on the interval <math alttext="0 less or equal than x less or equal than 10"><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>10</mn></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> is decreasing on <math alttext="0 less or equal than x less or equal than 10"><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>10</mn></math>.

​​<math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> is decreasing on <math alttext="0 less or equal than x less than 5"><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>5</mn></math>; <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> is increasing on <math alttext="5 less than x less or equal than 10"><mn>5</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>10</mn></math>.

​​<math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> is decreasing on <math alttext="0 less or equal than x less than 5"><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>5</mn></math>; <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> is neither increasing nor decreasing on <math alttext="5 less than x less or equal than 10"><mn>5</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>10</mn></math>.

​<math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> is decreasing on <math alttext="0 less or equal than x less than 5"><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>5</mn></math>; <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> can be increasing, decreasing, or both increasing and decreasing on <math alttext="5 less than x less or equal than 10"><mn>5</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>10</mn></math>.

content.answer: ​<math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> is decreasing on <math alttext="0 less or equal than x less than 5"><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>5</mn></math>; <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> can be increasing, decreasing, or both increasing and decreasing on <math alttext="5 less than x less or equal than 10"><mn>5</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>10</mn></math>.
